definitions: in a way that is quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences

examples.text: plants respond sensitively to the environment

shortDefinitions: in way that is quick to detect or respond to slight changes or influences

definitions: in a manner that shows quickness to take offense or become upset

examples.text: there is no need to react sensitively over every statement

shortDefinitions: in manner that shows quickness to take offence or become upset

definitions: with a quick and delicate appreciation of others' feelings

examples.text: the issue needs to be handled sensitively
responding sensitively to parental anxiety remains essential

shortDefinitions: with quick and delicate appreciation of others' feelings

examples.text: the Edwardian property has been sensitively restored and redecorated

definitions: in a way that ensures secrecy or restrictions on disclosure

examples.text: any information we receive will be treated sensitively
